clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation Between Surgical Therapy of the Lipedema Compared to Complex Physical Decongestive Therapy (CDT) Alone
clinical_study.official_title: MULTICENTER, CONTROLLED, RANDOMIZED, INVESTIGATOR-BLINDED CLINICAL STUDY ON EFFICACY AND SAFETY OF SURGICAL THERAPY OF LIPEDEMA COMPARED TO COMPLEX PHYSICAL DECONGESTIVE THERAPY ALONE (LIPLEG)

collaborator.agency: Coordinating Centre for Clinical Trials Cologne

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose is to determine whether surgical therapy of lipedema (stage I, II or III) using Liposuction the pain in the legs compared to the use of complex decongestive therapy (CDT) relevant improved.

detailed_description.textblock:
Lipedema is associated with reduced quality of life of patients due to persistent pain (in stages I, II or III).
Because the biological cause of lipedema is not known, there is no basic specific therapy.
The Treatment with complex decongestive therapy is lengthy and usually does not lead to a significant improvement in the lipedema of the legs.
An alternative may be given by the surgical treatment by means of liposuction.
However, there are currently only low meaningful data from published studies, which show a potential for the effectiveness of surgical treatment of lipedema.
A direct comparison of the Liposuction with complex decongestive therapy in a randomized, controlled, multicentre study is necessary to establish a meaningful database.
The purpose is to determine whether surgical therapy of lipedema (stage I, II or III) using Liposuction the pain in the legs compared to the use of complex decongestive therapy relevant improved.
The primary endpoint is the relevant reduction in the average pain of last four weeks in the legs (≥ 2 points on a numerical rating scale; German Pain Questionnaire) 12 months after completed liposuction treatment (intervention group) or after randomisation (control group) compared to the time of randomization.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: After a run in phase, randomisation is performed in the intervention and control arm (2:1).
study_design_info.masking_description: Random assignment of patients to one of the two treatment groups (experiemental or cotrolled) is provided centrally via a 24/7 Internet service in ratio 2:1 (experiemental/cotrolled) based on permuted blocks. The assignment is layered to stage and center.

primary_outcome.measure: Successful pain reduction: visual analogue scale
primary_outcome.description: Successful pain reduction after 12 months (Stage I, II or III; ≥ 2 points on a visual analogue scale)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change 12 months after completed liposuction treatment (intervention group) or after randomisation (control group) compared to the Time of randomisation
secondary_outcome.description: Change in the severity of the Pain in the legs(stage I, II or III)

arm_group.description: Patients receive the liposuction operation(s) in the following. The number varies according to need (maximum four operations) with 5-7 weeks interval between each respective operations.
The control group will be treated for 12 months with CDT alone.

intervention.description: In the intervention arm, the patients receive liposuction treatment according to the study protocol using the "wet technique" depending on the amount of fat to be removed, if necessary in several sessions.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Signed informed consent form
2. female
3. age ≥ 18 years
4. lipedema of the legs stage I, II or III
5. average pain in the legs during the last four weeks ≥ 4 points on a numerical rating scale
6. documentation of an insufficient complaint relief by conservative methods
7. willingness and ability to take conservative measures according to the study plan,during and if necessary after the liposuction treatment
8. full legal capacity
Exclusion Criteria:
1. simultaneous lipoedema of the arms and legs, in which the involvement of the arms influences the primary endpoint
2. previous liposuctions
3. diseases affecting operability , e.g. cardiac diseases, coagulation disorders, metabolic diseases, body weight >120.0 kg, infectious diseases (active), epilepsy; diseases requiring immunosuppression or anticoagulation; allergies to medication before and during surgery
4. diseases influencing adequate CDT , e.g. heart failure (volume stress), lack ofphysical ability to wear compression stockings (e.g.joint diseases, neurological deficits)
5. primary obesity without disproportion and without evidence of lipedema
6. secondary obesity
7. fat distribution disorders of other genesis (e.g. painless lipohypertrophy, benign symmetrical lipomatosis or lipomatosis dolorosa)
8. other edema-causing diseases (such as lymphedema, phlebdema or myxedema)
9. lack of willingness to provide adequate contraception
10. positive pregnancy test
11. lactation period
12. usage of a lymphomat
13. participation in other clinical studies
14. cosmetic motivation for participating in the study

eligibility.gender_description: The lipedema is a symmetrical one, excessive adipose tissue proliferation on the legs, which is almost occurs exclusively in women.
